results.title: North west link
results.brief_description: Made by Telecom and the Postmaster-Generals dept. the film shows the work of laying a 600-mile coaxial cable from Perth to Carnarvon, W.A. The pipe is a link in the national broad-band telecommunication network extending the range of subscriber trunk dialling and television relay facilities.

results.title: North West Frontier = Flame over India
results.creator_credit: J Thompson, Mariel Hellman and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Captain Scott (Kenneth More), is commissioned by the British Governor of colonial India for a rescue mission to ensure the safe passage of a five year old Hindi prince and his American governess (Lauren Bacall) out of danger. To achieve this Scott must make a 300 mile journey to Kalapur. The mission is fraught with danger as they are travelling on an old and fragile train, and an assassin has made his way onto the train and is posing as an ally. Cast includes Herbert Lom, Wilfred Hyde-White and Ursula Jeans.
results.creator_credit_for_label: J Thompson, Mariel Hellman and Rank Organisation Film Productions

results.title: North to Wales
results.creator_credit: Michael Clarke, Ian Ferguson and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: This is a historical journey of Wales, a reminiscent perspective of the narrator’s life in Wales from a young lad to his return. We travel across Wales focusing on this beautiful and picturesque countryside full of wild country views to the ruined castles that protect its mountains.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Clarke, Ian Ferguson and British Transport Films

results.title: North Sea
results.creator_credit: Harry Watt, Alberto Cavalcanti and GPO Film Unit
results.brief_description: Made to publicise the English GPOs ship to shore radio service, this was the first documentary film to pay its way in Britain by getting theatrical release in commercial cinemas, and for this achievement it was a special triumph for the pioneering documentary filmmakers. “North Sea” tells the story of the big gale of 1937. The crew of the trawler “John Gillman” are introduced as they leave their homes in Aberdeen to rejoin their ship. As the “John Gillman” and crew ride out the gale, wives and families wait anxiously at the Wick Radio Station. After 48 hours of silence a signal finally comes through.

results.title: North Pacific
results.creator_credit: Rex Tasker, Walford Hewitson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: It is an ocean of plenty, a vast aquatic pasture teeming with many species of fish and other marine life. Most sought is the salmon, but sometimes they do not “run.” This film shows extensive studies of the ocean to determine how temperatures, winds, currents, and plankton affect the sea harvest.

results.title: North of Vortex
results.creator_credit: Constantine Giannaris, Rebecca Dobbs and Western Connection
results.brief_description: This early work by Greek filmmaker Giannaris is an evocative road movie shot on location in striking black-and-white in New York and the wide open spaces of the American West. A gay poet from driving across the continent in his convertible picks up a bisexual sailor and a desperate waitress. Cool and leisurely-paced, the film explores the shifting (and occasionally explosive) emotional and power relationships between the three as they play out their romantic and sexual fantasies with one another. Cast: Stavros Zalmas, Howard Napper, Valda Drabla.

results.title: North of 60 east
results.creator_credit: T.R. Wagstaff, E.L. Burnell, Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: On patrol with the Royal Canadian Mounted Police of the eastern Canadian Arctic, north of the 60th parallel. This film shows the day-to-day routine of constables who police the vast area that includes Baffin and Ellesmere Islands. For those who might choose northern service, the film provides clear impressions of the requirements of this detachment; for the general audience it gives an interesting overall view of the people, life and environment in the eastern Arctic.

results.title: North Kimberley expedition
results.brief_description: An area of some 30,000 square miles in the North Kimberleys, Western Australia has not been settled. The film covers a survey expedition ot the great expanse of uninhabited country between Karunjie-Gibb River and Kalumburn Mission. Expedition leader: John F. Morgan.
